tr.td: That the Solemn Affirmation and Declaration of the People called Quakers, shall be accepted instead of an Oath in the usual Form.

Quakers instead of Oath, to make Affirmation in the Form therein mentioned, which is to have the Effect of an Oath.
Another Form of Oath enacted, 8 G. I. c.6.
False Affirmation to incur the Penalty of Perjury.
Quaker refusing to pay Tithe upon Complaint, Two Justices (unless either of them be patron or interested) may proceed.
In what Case Costs against Appellant—No Certiorari, &c. except where Title of Tithes in Question.

Quaker not to give Evidence in Criminal Causes, or bear Office, &c.
See 13 & 14 W. III. c. 4.; and as to Quakers refusing to make Affirmation in Cases of Election, see 6 Ann. c. 23. § 13.–1 G. I. st. 2. c. 13. § 4.

Continuance of Act.
As to Quakers neglecting to pay Tithes, see 53 G. III. c. 127. § 6.
Query if this Act made perpetual, 1 G.I. Stat. 2. c. 6. § 2. further than relates to Tithes.
See East India Company.
For making perpetual and more effectual, an Act for preventing Delays at the Quarter Sessions of the Peace.
Stat.5&6 W. & M. c. 11. made perpetual.
Party prosecuting any Certiorari to remove an Indictment, may find Two Manucaptors to enter into a Recognizance, &c.
Party to appear Daily in the King's Bench Court, until discharged.

Provision made for Assignment by him of certain reversionary Tallies.
According to Stat. 4 W. & M. c. 3. and 9 W. III. c. 24. See 5 G.I. c. 2. § 8.

For making and keeping navigable the Rivers of Aire & Calder in the County of York.
This Act amended, 14 G. III. c. 96.

Avon and Frome, for better preserving the Navigation of the Rivers of.
See Local Acts, tit. Bristol.

Larke, alias Burn, in the County of Suffolk, for making the River of, navigable.
See a Proviso for this Navigation, 57 G. III. c. 20. Pr. See also 57 G. III. c. lxxi.

For making and keeping the River Tone navigable, from Bridgwater to Taunton, in the County of Somerset.
See 6 Ann. c. 9. Pr. 44 G. III. c. lxxxiii. § 3.

Trent, for making and keeping navigable.
See 23 G. III. c. 41.

For making navigable the Rivers of Wye and Lugg, in the County of Hereford.
See Stat. 13 & 14 Car. II. c. 14. Pr. —13 G. I. c. 34.–49 G. III. c. lxxviii.
See Coin and Coinage.
Subjects of this Country may on Request, as herein mentioned, be admitted Members of the Russia Company.
£ 5 and no more, to be taken for Admission.
Within Ten Days after request and tender of £5, Company to admit and to administer the Oath taken by Members.

Yearly Account to Parliament.
As to repeal of this Section, see 59 G. III. c. 103. § 1. A Trade opened to and from Persia through Russia, 14 G. II. c. 36.
